Brilliant game. Was way ahead of its time.
The Greatest FPS of all time!

As a Great British citizen I can say with great confidence that this is a perfect recreation of what it's like to live in Birmingham. From the random violence, to the strange men that follow you around, this game is able to keep it true to life while remaining endlessly entertaining. 
I rate this 10/10 and highly recommend it to those who want a feel for what it's like to be British, without actually visiting our beautiful country in person.

Welcome. Welcome to City 17.

You have chosen, or been chosen, to relocate to one of our finest remaining urban centers. I thought so much of City 17 that I elected to establish my Administration here, in the Citadel so thoughtfully provided by Our Benefactors. I have been proud to call City 17 my home. And so, whether you are here to stay, or passing through on your way to parts unknown, welcome to City 17. It's safer here.

Dr. Breen to all new citizens
By Polish Guy

Wow!

Half-Life was such an amazing journey even by modern standards, but this game is something else. Turns out it is very fun to throw things around with the gravity gun.
This game is amazing. The graphics are so good for a game this old. The story line makes me wanna c-
I guess you should go with Alyx.
Nostalgic and Timeless. It never ceases to amaze me. And now i get to pass it on to my kids.
Time, Dr. Freeman? Is it really that time again? It seems as if you only just arrived.

so yeah its good.

Years ago since my last game here, it's time to place a short review about this masterpiece. I think is the unique title in Valve's series, with 3 episodes: Half-Life and its Episode One and Two. Even when they called Episode 2, is the third title in the series. No other game that came out from Valve's studios has got this large approval from the crowd.

Half-Life was not just a game but introduced a new 3D game engine in early 2000, where games started to become all about graphics. And even today, after decades of its first release, the game looks still gorgeous, with full support for 3 displays setup. I just love it!
